column4: how do I check active processes and how the RAM is spent with command line (Ubuntu Server)?
Well, I'd start by typing "top" for the procesess, and "free -m " for memory, "top" will show it up too but in another, less readable form.
Check "man top" and "man free", they provide some really useful options, like "free -ms 2", will show you memory usage with 2 sec interval, and so on.
